poem:
### Deluge of the Denied

Mud and water, they ransack
our threshold dreams—leaves us,
knee-deep in despair. 

Forms filed, tears dried,
our needs get washed away,
slip between the cracks.

We ask for hands, they give us 
transparent promises—the paper floods.

The rain stops, 
but our wares remain soaked in silence.
